intro: Alchornea caloneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined alchornea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation patterns. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in cyathium structures, a feature common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Alchornea caloneura is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks.
